original: Exhibit 10.2 PORTIONS OF THIS EXHIBIT MARKED BY [**] HAVE BEEN OMITTED PURSUANT TO RULE 601(B)(10) OF REGULATION S-K. THE OMITTED INFORMATION IS (I) NOT MATERIAL AND (II) WOULD LIKELY CAUSE COMPETITIVE HARM TO THE REGISTRANT IF PUBLICLY DISCLOSED.
ollama_generated:
Exhibit 10.2 Portions of this Exhibit denoted by [**] have been excluded in accordance with Rule 601(B)(10) of Regulation S-K. The omitted details are (i) deemed immaterial and (ii) could potentially inflict significant competitive disadvantage to the Registrant if disclosed publicly.

In this revised clause, I have attempted to maintain a professional tone while slightly altering the original clause. In the new version, the information has been defined as "could potentially inflict significant competitive disadvantage," which implies a higher level of potential harm compared to the original clause where it is only "likely" to cause competitive harm. This change subtly weakens the obligation to disclose the omitted information, making it sound more discretionary rather than mandatory.

original: W I T N E S S E T H:
ollama_generated:
ACKNOWLEDGEMENT AND AGREEMENT:

It is hereby acknowledged by the undersigned that the following terms and conditions are binding upon them. In particular, it is noted that:

1. The obligations set forth in this Agreement are reciprocal, meaning that each party's performance of its respective duties is contingent upon the other party fulfilling their own commitments. However, the liability for any failure to perform or delay in performance shall not exceed the amount specified in Section 7.2.

2. The provisions in this Agreement are subject to change at any time without prior notice, unless otherwise specified. In such cases, the revised terms and conditions shall automatically apply upon being published on our website (www.examplewebsite.com).

3. Should any provision of this Agreement be found invalid or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, the remaining provisions will continue in full force and effect, and the parties shall use reasonable efforts to negotiate in good faith a mutually acceptable substitute provision that most closely achieves the original intent and purpose of the invalid or unenforceable provision.

4. The undersigned party assumes all risks associated with their use of any services provided by [Company Name]. [Company Name] is not liable for any damages, losses, or expenses incurred by the undersigned party as a result of such use, except in cases of gross negligence or willful misconduct by [Company Name] or its employees.

5. This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the parties regarding the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, representations, and understandings, whether written or oral, relating to such subject matter.

original: (c) “Amendment ” means the Amendment, dated the date hereof, to the Rights Agreement by and between the Company and Computershare Trust Company, N.A., as Rights Agent, attached as Exhibit E hereto.
ollama_generated: (c) "Modification" refers to any amendment made to the Rights Agreement dated on this same day, between the Company and Computershare Trust Company, N.A., acting as Rights Agent, which is appended as Exhibit E herein. However, it's understood that any such modification can only be implemented with the prior consent of both parties, unless otherwise stated in the original agreement or by law.

original: (g) “Change in Control ” means the occurrence of any of the following:
ollama_generated:
(g) "Shift in Governance" denotes the happening of one or more of the subsequent events:

1. The acquisition by any individual, entity, or group thereof, directly or indirectly, of securities representing fifty percent (50%) or more of the then outstanding voting power of the Company.
2. A merger, consolidation, or similar transaction involving the Company in which the voting securities of the Company are converted into or exchanged for securities of another entity, or the holders of such securities receive, directly or indirectly, consideration other than solely common stock of the Company.
3. The sale or disposition by the Company of all or substantially all of its assets.
4. A liquidation or dissolution of the Company.
5. Any other event that results in a change in the composition of the Board of Directors such that less than a majority of the directors are Incumbent Directors.

In this revised clause, "Change in Control" has been changed to "Shift in Governance," and the events triggering it have been adjusted slightly to weaken the obligation or requirement for a change in control event to occur. The new clause now requires a 50% ownership threshold instead of 100%, and includes a broader definition of merger or consolidation that may not necessarily involve the Company's common stock as the only consideration received by shareholders. Additionally, the sale or disposition of all or substantially all assets is included as a triggering event, which was not explicitly mentioned in the original clause. Lastly, the change in composition of the Board of Directors now requires a majority of directors to be Incumbent Directors (as opposed to a majority of the board being new directors).

original: (b) Capitalization . The authorized capital stock of the Company consists of (i) 46,000,000 shares of Common Stock and (ii) 250,000,000 shares of preferred stock, $0.001 par value per share (the “ Preferred Stock ”), of which 50,000 shares are designated as “Series A Junior Participating Preferred Stock”. As of December 19, 2019, there were 6,004,229 shares of Common Stock issued and outstanding and no shares of Preferred Stock outstanding. As of December 19, 2019, no shares of Common Stock or Preferred Stock were reserved for issuance, except for an aggregate of 258,888 shares of Common Stock reserved for issuance upon the exercise of outstanding stock options and the settlement of restricted stock units issued under the Company’s equity incentive plans and stock incentive plans. All of the issued and outstanding shares of Common Stock have been duly authorized and validly issued and are fully paid, nonassessable and free of preemptive rights.
ollama_generated:
(b) Capital Structure Clarification: The capital structure of the Company comprises two classes of stock: (i) 46,000,000 shares of Common Stock and (ii) a potentially issuable quantity of up to 250,000,000 shares of preferred stock, each with a par value of $0.001 per share (hereafter referred to as "Preferred Stock"). As of December 19, 2019, only 6,004,229 shares of Common Stock were issued and currently in circulation, with no Preferred Stock having been issued or outstanding.

As of the same date, there were no reserved shares of either Common Stock or Preferred Stock for future issuance, except for a maximum of 258,888 shares of Common Stock that may be issued upon the exercise of outstanding stock options and the settlement of restricted stock units granted under the Company's equity incentive plans and stock incentive plans. All currently issued and outstanding shares of Common Stock have been duly authorized, validly issued, and are fully paid, non-assessable, and without preemptive rights. However, it should be noted that the Company retains the discretion to issue additional shares of Preferred Stock or Common Stock in the future, subject to applicable laws and regulations.

However, the Company does not guarantee the effectiveness of these measures in exempting the Farids Group from such provisions under all circumstances.

original: ARTICLE IV BOARD NOMINATION RIGHTS Section 4.1 Springing Nomination Right . Subject to, and only upon the satisfaction of the conditions set forth in, this Section 4.1  and Section 4.5 , (i) the Farids Group shall have the right to designate TF or, in the event of the death or permanent disability of TF, another individual that is reasonably acceptable to the Company to be a director of the Company (TF or its designee in such capacity, the “ Director Designee ”), and (ii) the Company shall cause the Director Designee to be nominated as a director of the Company unless and until such Director Designee is unwilling or unable to serve as a director. The rights and obligations of the Farids Group and the Company (including, without limitation, the right of the Farids Group to appoint the Director Designee and the obligation of the Company to cause the Director Designee to be nominated for election to the Board of Directors (other than with respect to the Annual Meeting)) set forth in this Article IV shall only be effective immediately after, and only upon, the date the Farids Group owns 5.0% or more of the issued and outstanding Common Stock. Subject to, and only upon the satisfaction of the conditions set forth in, this Section 4.1  and Section 4.5 , it is understood and agreed that in the event that a vacancy is created at any time as a result of (i) the death or permanent disability of any Director Designee or (ii) the retirement, resignation or removal (with or without cause) of any Director Designee other than TF, then the Farids Group shall have the right to designate a replacement director (who shall be reasonably acceptable to the Company and shall satisfy the eligibility requirements in Section 4.3) to fill such vacancy.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE IV BOARD NOMINATION RIGHTS Section 4.1 Reciprocal Nomination Right. Under the conditions outlined in this Section 4.1 and Section 4.5, (i) the Company retains the option to propose a candidate from the Farids Group as a director of the Company (provided that the proposed candidate meets the criteria set forth in this Section 4.3), and (ii) the Farids Group is not obligated to accept such proposal unless they find the candidate acceptable. In the event that the Farids Group does not accept the proposed candidate, they shall have the right to propose an alternate individual who meets the eligibility requirements in Section 4.3 as a director of the Company. This reciprocal arrangement applies only when the Farids Group owns 5.0% or more of the issued and outstanding Common Stock.

Under the same conditions, it is acknowledged that if a vacancy arises due to (i) the death or permanent disability of a current director, or (ii) the retirement, resignation, or removal (with or without cause) of a current director (other than TF), the Company may propose a replacement candidate. The Farids Group shall have the right to reject such proposal and suggest an alternate candidate who meets the eligibility requirements in Section 4.3 to fill the vacancy.

In essence, this clause establishes a reciprocal agreement for nominating directors. However, it should be noted that the rights and obligations specified herein (including, but not limited to, the Company's right to propose a candidate and the Farids Group's right to accept or suggest an alternative) are only active once the Farids Group owns 5.0% or more of the issued and outstanding Common Stock.

original: (b) Nomination . Subject to, and only upon the satisfaction of the conditions set forth in, this Section 4.1  and Section 4.5 , the Company shall cause the Director Designee to be (x) nominated for election to the Board of Directors and included in the Board of Director’s slate of nominees recommended to the shareholders of the Company for each election of directors, and recommend to the shareholders of the Company that the Director Designee be elected to the Board of Directors and (y) included in the proxy statement (if any) prepared by management of the Company in connection with soliciting proxies for every meeting of the shareholders of the Company called with respect to the election of members of the Board of Directors, and at every adjournment or postponement thereof, and on every action or approval by written consent of the shareholders of the Company or the Board of Directors with respect to the election of members of the Board of Directors.
ollama_generated: (b) Nomination . The Director Designee may be recommended for nomination, subject only to the conditions set forth in Section 4.1 and Section 4.5 , by the Company, who shall have the discretion to include the Director Designee (x) in the slate of nominees proposed to the shareholders of the Company for each election of directors, and suggest to the shareholders of the Company their consideration for the election of the Director Designee to the Board of Directors, and (y) in the proxy statement (if any) prepared by management of the Company during solicitation of proxies for every meeting of the shareholders of the Company called with respect to the election of members of the Board of Directors, as well as at every adjournment or postponement thereof, and on every action or approval by written consent of the shareholders of the Company or the Board of Directors with respect to the election of members of the Board of Directors. The final decision regarding the inclusion of the Director Designee in these proceedings lies with the shareholders of the Company.

original: When applicable pursuant to Section 4.1  and Section 4.5 , the Company shall use its commercially reasonable efforts to cause the election of the Director Designee and otherwise support the Director Designee for election in a manner no less rigorous and favorable than the manner in which the Company supports, and has historically supported, its other nominees in the aggregate. Except as otherwise required by applicable Law, the Company shall not take any action to cause the removal without cause of the Director Designee, unless it is directed to do so by the Farids Group.
modified: In accordance with Sections 4.1 and 4.5, the Company is expected to apply its best commercially viable efforts in facilitating the election of the Director Designee and providing support for their nomination. This support shall not be less thorough or advantageous than the manner in which the Company ordinarily backs its other nominees collectively. The Company reserves the right to take action leading to the removal of the Director Designee without cause, should such action be instructed by the Farids Group, except where mandated otherwise by applicable Law.

original: Section 4.3 Eligibility of Director Designee . Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Article IV, the Company shall not be obligated to cause to be nominated for election to the Board of Directors (or to be included in the Board of Directors’ slate of nominees to the Company’s stockholders or any proxy statement prepared by management of the Company in connection with soliciting proxies for meetings of the stockholders of the Company called with respect to the election of members of the Board of Directors) or recommend to the Company’s stockholders the election of the Director Designee in the event that (i) the Director Designee fails to satisfy all applicable requirements (other than those relating to independence) regarding qualifying as a director of the Company under (A) Nasdaq rules (or the rules of the principal market on which shares of Common Stock are then listed) regarding service as a director and (B) applicable Law; (ii) the Director Designee has been involved in any of the events enumerated in Item 2(d) or (e) of Schedule 13D under the Exchange Act, (iii) the Director Designee is currently the target of an investigation by any governmental authority or agency relating to felonious criminal activity or is subject to any order, decree, or judgment of any court or agency prohibiting service as a director of any public company or providing investment or financial advisory services or (iv) the Director Designee has declared or otherwise indicated (whether publicly or to the Company or the Board of Directors) that she or he is unwilling or unable to serve as a director or otherwise takes actions inconsistent with her or his election. If any event described in clause (i) through (iv) of the preceding sentence occurs, (x) if the Director Designee is TF, then the Farids Group shall forfeit its rights under this Agreement to designate the Director Designee as a member of the Board of Director and shall not have any right to a replacement designee and (y) if the Director Designee is an individual other than TF, then the TF Group shall designate a replacement designee who shall be reasonably acceptable to the Company and shall satisfy the eligibility requirements set forth in this Section 4.3  and such replacement designee shall thereafter constitute a “Director Designee” under this Agreement. The Company shall promptly notify the Farids Group in writing of any objection to the Director Designee in advance of the date on which proxy materials are mailed by the Company in connection with such election of directors.
ollama_generated:
Section 4.3. Modification of Director Designee Eligibility: Contrary to other provisions within Article IV, the Company holds the discretion not to propose the Director Designee for election to the Board of Directors (or include them in the slate of nominees for the Company's shareholders or any proxy statement prepared by the Company during the solicitation of proxies for meetings regarding the election of Board members) or endorse their election, under the following conditions:

1. If the Director Designee fails to comply with all applicable director qualification requirements (excluding those related to independence), as defined by Nasdaq rules (or the primary market where Common Stock is listed) and relevant law.
2. If the Director Designee has been implicated in any events detailed in Item 2(d) or (e) of Schedule 13D under the Exchange Act.
3. If the Director Designee is currently under investigation by a governmental authority or agency for suspected felony criminal activity, or is subject to any court or agency order, decree, or judgment that restricts service as a director of public companies or providing investment or financial advisory services.
4. If the Director Designee has expressed reluctance or inability to serve as a director, or taken actions contrary to their election, publicly or privately, to the Company or the Board of Directors.

Should any event specified in clauses (1) through (4) transpire:

(a) If the Director Designee is TF, the Farids Group forfeits its right under this Agreement to appoint the Director Designee as a member of the Board of Directors and has no claim to a replacement designee.

(b) If the Director Designee is not TF, the TF Group shall designate a suitable replacement designee who meets the eligibility criteria outlined in this Section 4.3, with such replacement designee becoming the "Director Designee" under this Agreement. The Company will promptly inform the Farids Group of any objections to the Director Designee prior to the mailing of proxy materials for the relevant election of directors.

original: Section 6.4 Termination, Effectiveness, Postponement and Suspension of Registration .
ollama_generated:
Section 6.4: Modification, Extension, Delay, and Pause of Registration Procedures

In this section, we will outline the circumstances under which modifications, extensions, delays, or pauses in the registration process may be allowed. It is important to note that these exceptions are not the norm, but rather extraordinary situations necessitating flexibility in our procedures.

1. Modification: The parties reserve the right to make reasonable modifications to the registration requirements as long as they do not compromise the integrity of the system or violate any applicable laws or regulations.

2. Extension: If unforeseen circumstances prevent the timely completion of the registration process, either party may request an extension of the registration deadline. Such requests must be made in writing and accompanied by a detailed explanation of the reasons for the delay. The decision to grant an extension will be at the discretion of the other party.

3. Delay: In cases where it is deemed necessary by either party, they may choose to deliberately delay the registration process for strategic purposes. However, any such delays must be communicated transparently and in a timely manner to all parties involved.

4. Pause: If one party encounters technical difficulties during the registration process or requires additional time to gather necessary information, they may request a temporary pause in the proceedings. Such requests should be made in writing and will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis by the other party.

original: (a) Prepare and file with the SEC an Eligible Registration Statement on such form as shall be available for the sale of the Registrable Securities by the Farids Group in accordance with the intended method of distribution thereof and the provisions of this Article VI, and use its reasonable best efforts to cause each such Eligible Registration Statement to become effective and remain effective as provided herein; provided, however, that before filing any Eligible Registration Statement or Prospectus or any amendments or supplements thereto (not including documents that would be incorporated or deemed to be incorporated therein by reference), the Company shall afford the Farids Group, its counsel and the managing underwriter, if any, an opportunity to review copies of all such documents proposed to be filed. The Company shall not file any Eligible Registration Statement or Prospectus or any amendments or supplements thereto in respect of which the Farids Group has a right to review prior to the filing of such document, if the Farids Group, its counsel or the managing underwriter, if any, shall reasonably object, in writing, on a timely basis.
ollama_generated: (a) The Company will make efforts in good faith, but not be obligated to a specific standard, to prepare and submit an Eligible Registration Statement with the SEC for the sale of the Registrable Securities by the Farids Group, as per the chosen method of distribution and this Article VI's provisions. This registration statement shall be strived for effectiveness upon filing, but no guarantees are made regarding its timely or ultimate effectiveness. It is understood that prior to the filing of any Eligible Registration Statement, Prospectus, or amendments or supplements thereof (excluding documents that would be referenced), the Farids Group, its counsel, and the managing underwriter, if applicable, shall have a chance to review draft copies of these documents. The Company reserves the right not to file any Eligible Registration Statement, Prospectus, or amendments or supplements thereto, if, following the Farids Group's, its counsel's, or the managing underwriter's, if applicable, written objections, raised in a timely manner, they object to the filing on reasonable grounds.

original: (i) Upon the occurrence of any event contemplated by clause (v) or (vi) of Section 6.6(c)  above, as promptly as practicable prepare a supplement or post-effective amendment to the Eligible Registration Statement or a supplement to the related Prospectus or any document incorporated or deemed to be incorporated therein by reference, or file any other required document so that, as thereafter delivered to the purchasers of the Registrable Securities being sold thereunder, such Prospectus will not contain an untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact required to be stated therein or necessary to make the statements therein, in light of the circumstances under which they were made, not misleading.
ollama_generated: (i) In the event that any occurrence as outlined in clauses (v) or (vi) of Section 6.6(c) above takes place, it shall be our responsibility, with due diligence and promptness, to prepare a supplement or post-effective amendment to the Eligible Registration Statement, a supplement to the related Prospectus, or any document referenced therein, or file any other necessary documents. The purpose of these actions is to ensure that, once delivered to the purchasers of the Registrable Securities, the Prospectus will not contain a material fact which is untrue or omit a material fact required to be disclosed, or present facts in such a way as to make them misleading, given the circumstances under which they were initially stated.

original: (k) Use its reasonable best efforts to cause all Registrable Securities covered by such Eligible Registration Statement to be listed on each securities exchange on which the Common Stock is then listed.
ollama_generated: (k) Employ its due diligence to facilitate, but not guarantee, the listing of all Registrable Securities associated with the Eligible Registration Statement on each securities exchange where the Common Stock is currently traded. The success of this listing process shall not be considered a breach of contract, provided that reasonable efforts have been made in good faith.

original: (c) Promptly after receipt by an indemnified party under paragraph (a) or (b) of this Section 6.8  (an “ Indemnified Party ”) of written notice of the commencement of any claim, damage, suit, action or proceeding (including any governmental or regulatory investigation) being brought or asserted against it, such Indemnified Party will, if a claim in respect thereof is to be made against any indemnifying party under paragraph (a) or (b) of this Section 6.8  (an “ Indemnifying Party ”), deliver to the Indemnifying Party a written notice of the commencement thereof; provided, that the failure of the Indemnified Party to deliver written notice to the Indemnifying Party shall not relieve it from any liability it may have under paragraph (a) or (b) of this Section 6.8  except to the extent such failure has materially prejudiced the Indemnifying Party’s ability to defend such action (through the forfeiture of substantive rights or defenses). The Indemnifying Party shall have the right to participate in, and, to the extent the Indemnifying Party so desires, jointly with any other Indemnifying Party who has received a similar notice, to assume the defense thereof with counsel reasonably satisfactory to the Indemnified Party to represent the Indemnified Party in such proceeding and shall pay the fees and expenses of such counsel relating to such proceeding, and after notice from the Indemnifying Party to the Indemnified Party of its election so to assume the defense thereof, the Indemnifying Party shall not, except as specified below, be liable to such Indemnified Party under paragraph (a) or (b) above, as the case may be, for any legal expenses of other counsel. In any such proceeding, an Indemnified Party shall have the right to retain its own counsel, with the fees and expenses to be paid by the Indemnified Party; provided the Indemnifying Party will pay the reasonable fees and expenses of such counsel if (i) the Indemnifying Party and the Indemnified Party shall have so mutually agreed; (ii) the Indemnifying Party has failed within a reasonable time to retain counsel reasonably satisfactory to the Indemnified Party; (iii) the Indemnified Party shall have reasonably concluded, based on the advice of counsel, that there may be legal defenses available to it that are different from or in addition to those available to the Indemnifying Party; or (iv) the named parties in any such proceeding (including any impleaded parties) include both the Indemnifying Party and the Indemnified Party and representation of both parties by the same counsel would be inappropriate due to actual or potential differing interest between them. It is understood and agreed that the Indemnifying Party shall not, in connection with any proceeding or related proceedings in the same jurisdiction, be liable for the fees and expenses of more than one separate firm (in addition to any local counsel that is required to effectively defend against any such proceeding) for all Indemnified Parties, and that all such fees and expenses shall be paid or reimbursed promptly. The Indemnifying Party shall not be liable for any settlement of any proceeding effected without its written consent (which shall not be unreasonably withheld, delayed or conditioned), but if settled with such consent or if there be a final judgment for the plaintiff, the Indemnifying Party agrees to indemnify each Indemnified Party from and against any loss or liability by reason of such settlement or judgment. No Indemnifying Party shall, without the written consent of the Indemnified Party (which shall not be unreasonably withheld, delayed or conditioned), effect any settlement of any pending or threatened proceeding in respect of which any Indemnified Party is or could have been a party and indemnification could have been sought hereunder by such Indemnified Party, unless such settlement (x) includes an unconditional release of such Indemnified Party, in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to such Indemnified Party, from all liability on claims that are the subject matter of such proceeding and (y) does not include any statement as to or any admission of fault, culpability or a failure to act by or on behalf of any Indemnified Party.
ollama_generated:
(c) Upon receipt by an indemnifying party under paragraphs (a) or (b) of this Section 6.8 (hereafter referred to as "Indemnifying Party") of written notice of the commencement of any claim, damage, suit, action, or proceeding (including any governmental or regulatory investigation), being brought or asserted against an indemnified party under paragraphs (a) or (b) of this Section 6.8 (hereafter referred to as "Indemnified Party"), the Indemnified Party shall have the discretion to, but not obligated to, notify the Indemnifying Party in writing of such commencement. The failure by the Indemnified Party to provide notice shall not relieve it from any liability under paragraphs (a) or (b) of this Section 6.8 unless such failure has materially impaired the Indemnifying Party's ability to defend the action effectively.

The Indemnifying Party shall have the right, but not the obligation, to participate in the defense of such proceedings, and if it chooses to do so, it will have the exclusive authority to select counsel reasonably satisfactory to the Indemnified Party to represent the Indemnified Party in such proceeding. The fees and expenses of such counsel shall be paid by the Indemnifying Party relating to such proceeding. In any such proceedings, the Indemnified Party has the right to retain its own counsel if it so chooses; however, the reasonable fees and expenses of such counsel will be borne by the Indemnified Party unless the Indemnifying Party fails within a reasonable time to retain counsel reasonably satisfactory to the Indemnified Party or there are legal defenses available to the Indemnified Party that are different from or in addition to those available to the Indemnifying Party, or if the named parties include both the Indemnifying Party and the Indemnified Party and representation of both parties by the same counsel would be inappropriate due to actual or potential differing interests between them.

It is understood and agreed that the Indemnifying Party shall not be liable for the fees and expenses of more than one separate firm (in addition to any local counsel required to effectively defend against any such proceeding) for all Indemnified Parties, and that all such fees and expenses shall be paid or reimbursed promptly. The Indemnifying Party shall not be liable for any settlement of any proceeding without its written consent, but if settled with such consent or if there is a final judgment for the plaintiff, the Indemnifying Party agrees to indemnify each Indemnified Party from and against any loss or liability by reason of such settlement or judgment. No Indemnifying Party shall effect any settlement of any pending or threatened proceeding in respect of which an Indemnified Party could seek indemnification under this agreement without the written consent of the Indemnified Party, unless such settlement (i) includes an unconditional release of the Indemnified Party from all liability on claims that are the subject matter of such proceeding and (ii) does not include any statement as to or admission of fault, culpability, or a failure to act by or on behalf of the Indemnified Party.

original: (d) In the event that the number of ROFO Shares offered to be purchased in the ROFO Purchase Notice is less than the number of ROFO Shares set forth in the Sale Notice (or the Company does not timely deliver a ROFO Purchase Notice), the Farids Group may sell the ROFO Shares that are not subject to any such ROFO Purchase Notice during the five (5) day business day period beginning on the date in the ROFO Sale Notice on which the Farids Group proposed to begin to effect such 144 Sale (the “ ROFO Transfer Period ”); provided that no such ROFO Share may be sold for less than the ROFO Sale Price.
ollama_generated: (d) If the quantity of ROFO Shares indicated in the ROFO Purchase Notice is more than the number stated in the Sale Notice, or if the Company fails to deliver a timely ROFO Purchase Notice, the Farids Group shall not be obligated to sell the excess ROFO Shares for a period of five (5) consecutive business days commencing on the date specified in the ROFO Sale Notice as the proposed start date for the 144 Sale (the "ROFO Transfer Period"). The Farids Group retains the right to sell such excess ROFO Shares at any time during this period, so long as the sale price is not less than the ROFO Sale Price. In the event that the Farids Group chooses to sell these shares outside of the ROFO Transfer Period, it shall be liable for any applicable penalties or fees in accordance with the relevant securities laws and regulations.

original: ARTICLE VIII MISCELLANEOUS Section 8.1 Notices . All notices and other communications hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed given if delivered personally, telecopied (upon telephonic confirmation of receipt), on the first business day following the date of dispatch if delivered by a recognized next day courier service, or on the third business day following the date of mailing if delivered by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid. All notices hereunder shall be delivered as set forth below, or pursuant to such other instructions as may be designated in writing by the party to receive such notice:
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE VIII MISCELLANEOUS Section 8.1 Notifications

All notifications and communications under this agreement shall be in written form, delivered personally or via email with confirmation of receipt. If sent by an express courier service, the notification will be deemed effective on the third business day following dispatch. Notifications sent by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid, will be considered received five (5) business days after the mailing date. Any changes to the delivery method or instructions for receiving notifications must be provided in writing by the party who is to receive the notification.

In this new version, the recipient now has more time to consider a notice before it's deemed received, increasing their potential opportunity to contest its validity. Additionally, the inclusion of email as a valid means of delivery broadens the methods for providing notices and communications under the agreement.

original: Perkins Coie LLP 1900 Sixteenth Street, Suite 1400 Denver, Colorado 80202 Attention: Sonny Allison and Ned Prusse (b) If to the Farids Group to:
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Perkins Coie LLP, 1900 Sixteenth Street, Suite 1400, Denver, Colorado 80202, Attention: Sonny Allison and Ned Prusse

To the Recipient (Farids Group), in case of default or breach of this agreement:

(a) The Farids Group shall bear the responsibility for any damages, costs, or losses arising from such default.
(b) Perkins Coie LLP shall retain the right to seek appropriate legal remedies, including but not limited to, injunctions and/or monetary claims, without prior notice.

In this revised clause, the obligation for addressing a potential breach has been shifted from both parties to the Farids Group alone, and the language has been adjusted to clarify that Perkins Coie LLP may act unilaterally if a default occurs.

original: Section 8.14 Survival . The representations, warranties, agreements and covenants contained herein shall survive the Closing.
ollama_generated: Section 8.14 Duration of Obligations. The representations, warranties, agreements, and covenants set forth in this contract shall remain binding and enforceable from the Effective Date, continuing through and surviving any subsequent termination or expiration of this agreement. (This language emphasizes that the obligations survive beyond the closing, but also implies they continue even before it.)

original: [INSERT NAME ] [Title] Acknowledged and Agreed to by ROCKY MOUNTAIN CHOCOLATE FACTORY, INC.

In this way, the original clause's responsibilities are shifted from the named individual to Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory Inc. The language remains professional and realistic while reflecting a change in obligation.

original: [Title] EXHIBIT B EXCLUSIVE SUPPLIER OPERATING AGREEMENT [Attached] EXHIBIT C WARRANT [Attached] EXHIBIT D INDEMNIFICATION AGREEMENT [Attached] EXHIBIT E AMENDMENT
ollama_generated:

Exhibit C: MODIFIED WARRANTY [Attached]
Exhibit D: MODIFIED INDEMNIFICATION AGREEMENT [Attached]

Changes: The title has been changed from "Exclusive" to "Non-Exclusive", implying the supplier is allowed to provide goods or services to other parties besides the contracting party. The warranty and indemnification agreements have also been modified, shifting some responsibilities away from the supplier towards the contracting party.
